item.title: How to make Raspberry Pi OS Bullseye more useful
item.description: Raspberry Pi OS is great for beginners but after a while you will start to realize that its desktop environment which is a modification of LXDE environment is rather limited to be used as a desktop. To make Raspberry Pi OS into the more standard Debian distro on which it is based on follow the following steps. Either select “Raspberry Pi OS Lite (64-bit)" or “Raspberry Pi OS Lite (32-bit)" and write it on your SD Card or USB Drive.

item.title: About
item.description: Hello my name is Safi ud Din Khan. I am from Lahore, Pakistan. I am mainly an Electrical Engineer by education but also a developer and have wide variety of other interests including history. I am also an advocate of free and open source software and a committed Linux user since 2013 but will also tolerate proprietary software if necessary. Though I am using Linux as my main OS since 2013 but I have been exposed to Linux, BSDs and some flavors of Unix since childhood and teenage years back in the late 90s and early 2000s though It was mainly as a curiosity back then and I did not knew much and did not take Linux seriously until 2013.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Feel Free to contact me both via my email address and via my social media accounts. My email address is safiuddinkhan@gmail.com Social Media Accounts My LinkedIn Account is https://www.linkedin.com/in/safi-ud-din-khan-b752ab13a/
